main event: On November 19, 1956, a ground-visual observation in Cape May, New Jersey reported a sighting of one large, white ball, approximately 20 feet in diameter, leaving a bluish trail and following a trajectory from northeast to southwest before disappearing into the woods.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a volleyball and left a bluish trail unlike a rocket.
The observation lasted for 60 to 120 seconds, and the object was seen for 10 to 15 seconds before disappearing into the woods.
The trajectory of the object was described as a horizontal arc from west to east.
The report suggested that the sighting could have been caused by a meteor, based on the object's description, duration, path, and manner of disappearance.
The observer was identified as a reliable Coast Guard seaman, backed by the officer of the day.
result: prosaic explanation, suggested to be caused by a meteor
sighted object: one large, white ball with a bluish trail
witnesses: reliable Coast Guard seaman, confirmed by officer of the day
